question_sentence: Israel launched air strikes on Damascus in support of which Syrian minority group?
evidence: Israel's bombs targeted Syria's defence ministry, after Syrian forces engaged in violent clashes with a Druze militia in the southern city of Suwayda. Benjamin Netanyahu said Israel – home to a large Druze minority – was acting to "save our Druze brothers", but Syria's interim president Ahmed al-Sharaa accused Israel of trying to "sow division".

question_sentence: Wildfires in Arizona's Grand Canyon National Park destroyed which historic site?
evidence: The White Sage and Dragon Bravo wildfires in Arizona have burned more than 40,000 acres and destroyed the historic Grand Canyon Lodge, built in 1937, along with up to 80 other structures on the North Rim. No injuries have been reported.

question_sentence: The European Commission announced a new proposed seven-year budget for the EU totalling how much?
evidence: Commission president Ursula von der Leyen said the 2028-2034 draft budget was the "most ambitious ever proposed". MEPs and member states will need to sign off on the package, equivalent to 1.26% of the bloc's gross national income, for it to come into effect when the current funding deal expires.

question_sentence: A hacker took over and posted offensive messages on which Sesame Street character's X account?
evidence: The children's show moved quickly to regain control of Elmo's X account after it was hacked and used to share racist and antisemitic messages with its 650,000 followers. The posts were deleted, and Elmo returned with a message saying, "Thank you for being kind to Elmo and all the people in your neighborhood. Elmo loves you."

question_sentence: Which of these nations did not make it to the quarter-finals of the UEFA Women's Euros 2025?
evidence: Despite a late goal from Telma Encarnação, Portugal lost 1-2 to Belgium at Switzerland's Stade de Tourbillon, finishing at the bottom of Group B. The group's runners-up, Italy, became the first side to make it to the semi-finals of the tournament with a 2-1 victory over Norway on Wednesday.

question_sentence: What item was stolen from a car belonging to one of Beyoncé's crew members, just before the star's Atlanta concert?
evidence: Thieves broke into a car used by the Beyoncé's choreographer, stealing a laptop with unreleased music and tour plans just days before the start of the singer's "Cowboy Carter" tour. Atlanta police have issued an arrest warrant, although the suspect's identity remains unknown.

question_sentence: Poland's prime minister went viral after eating a pasta dish featuring which unusual ingredient?
evidence: Donald Tusk shared the image of himself tucking into a plate of penne topped with chopped strawberries and a generous dollop of cream. The unusual meal was a tribute to Polish Wimbledon champion Iga Świątek, who had revealed her fondness for pasta with strawberries.

question_sentence: A prisoner in France escaped from an overcrowded jail by doing what?
evidence: The 20-year-old inmate escaped from a jail in Corbas, France, by hiding in the laundry bag of a cellmate who was being released. The escapee was captured near Lyon the next day after 24 hours on the run.

question_sentence: What is the most-nominated TV show for the 2025 Emmys?
evidence: Apple TV's surreal sci-fi satire is nominated for Outstanding Drama Series, as well as scoring individual acting nominations for lead Adam Scott and co-stars Britt Lower, Patricia Arquette, John Turturro, Zach Cherry and Tramell Tillman. Gritty Batman spin-off "The Penguin" was the next most-nominated, with 24, followed by "The Studio" and "The White Lotus" with 23 each.

question_sentence: Which popular game is getting its own social club in Las Vegas?
evidence: Mattel is launching a UNO Social Club at the Palms Casino this weekend, featuring themed rooms and exclusive variants of the iconic card game. However, you won't be able to gamble on UNO on the casino floor.

question_sentence: If President Donald Trump’s 30% tariffs are enacted against the European Union and Mexico, which products are expected to increase in price?
evidence: Produce could see price hikes if the tariffs are enacted. Prices for alcohol, medical equipment and electronics may also rise.

question_sentence: How much will it cost to build the US a new air traffic control system, according to Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy?
evidence: Duffy and the DOT plan to build a new air traffic control system by 2028, but only if they can get a total of $31.5 billion in funding from Congress.

question_sentence: More than 75 former federal and state judges called on the Senate Judiciary Committee to reject the nomination of which of President Trump’s former personal attorneys to a prestigious appeals court judgeship?
evidence: Emil Bove has an “egregious record of mistreating law enforcement officers, abusing power and disregarding the law itself,” the judges stated in a letter to the committee.

question_sentence: Thousands of federal employees at US health agencies were laid off this week. How were they notified?
choices: In a Zoom meeting with HR
evidence: The workers received an email on Monday afternoon notifying them that they were out of a job as of the close of business.

question_sentence: President Trump has threatened to revoke which celebrity’s US citizenship?
evidence: Comedian and actress Rosie O’Donnell, who moved to Ireland shortly before Trump was inaugurated, says she has no regrets about leaving the US.

question_sentence: Which of the following artificial intelligence companies recently received a $200 million Department of Defense contract after its chatbot pushed antisemitic tropes?
evidence: While all of the companies were awarded contracts of up to $200 million each, xAI’s chatbot Grok recently pushed antisemitic tropes in responses to some users’ queries, including “who is controlling the government.”

question_sentence: Why did an ad promoting tourism in Canada go viral?
choices: It featured a talking moose and squirrel
It showed a Canadian hugging an American
It starred Ryan Reynolds and a talking moose
It starred Ryan Gosling and a talking squirrel
evidence: The ad campaign showing a Canadian hugging an American tourist aims to make visitors from the US feel more welcome in Canada despite political and trade issues between the two countries.

question_sentence: Which animated character is set to appear on a new US postage stamp?
evidence: Four new forever stamps will feature SpongeBob SquarePants and the gang from Bikini Bottom.

question_sentence: A thief recently stole hard drives containing unreleased Beyoncé music and several other items. Where did the crime take place?
evidence: The thief targeted a car that was rented by the singer’s choreographer during a Cowboy Carter tour stop in Atlanta.

question_sentence: Which of the following world records was recently set in Tijuana, Mexico?
choices: The most Mariachi bands playing simultaneously
evidence: The world’s largest margarita came in at a massive 34,419 liters.
